reviews.review:
The content of this game is mindblowing. 
Storyline 10/10
Action 10/10
Gunplay 10/10
Magic (or whatever that is) 10/10
Character acting 9/10 
Graphics 8/10
Ending ?/10 You can decide that for yourself c;
This game has probably made it to my 2nd most favorite fps single player, maybe even 2nd most favorite game of all time other than Kingdom Hearts. This game is a must-have for all those adventure-seeking players out there, if you don't enjoy this game... Go die in a hole

This game is amazing, but be prepared for inception, because the ending is very confusing......so I will sum up the pros and cons to the story!
Pros:
+ Very good storytelling and foreshadowing
+ Fast paced FPS action
+ Brutal deaths
+ A variety of weapon combos
+ SKYHOOK!!!
+ Develop a bond with Elizabeth
Cons:
- Average gunplay
- VERY CONFUSING PLOT
- Not many Vigors(Infinite's version of plasmids)

Overall:

95/100

BUY IT

Amazing atmosphere of "Columbia". Graphics of the game are awesome.
Booker Dewitt very mysterious character cooperating with Elizabeth which is best female assistant ever .
Fable = 10/10
Character = 10/10
Graphics = 10/10
<3

Стоит ли брать? Конечно! Такого шедевра я еще не видел! Я имею в виду не супер боевку, исскуственный интелект и чудо графику(хотя графика очень приятная и цвета насыщенны не как во многиих шутерах), а про сюжет. Сюжет очень запутанный его нужно разбирать очень быстро так как игра короткая, но все же он шедевральный. От концовки я был в шоке,  настолько там интересная развяска что хочется найти объяснение этому. Объяснение находишь, но на это требуется много времени. Про остальное могу сказать что оружий вполне достаточно, способностей тоже, локации интересные и различаются между собой, много мелких деталей как и в построении уровней так и в сюжете. Баги встречаются, куда без них? Но они настолько редкие, что их вообще можно не заметить. Бои интересные, и скучно мне стало только когда я убивал три раза одного и того же босса, а так однообразия я не ощущал.

В итоге хорошая игра с хорошей графикой и великолепным сюжетом.

11/10
Шикарная игрушка, одна из моих любимых. Рекомендую!!!    10/10
I like the game the story and graphic is awsome, the best in bioshock games , I finished the game , planing replay to finish 1999 mode , and I would the DLC

Absolutely love the game. Was a little disapointed that the story in this game doesn't correlate alot with the other two games previous to this one and unlike the other two games, you can't save, so you are gonna have to be more careful with the choices you make. But inspite of all that, I love the certain realism you get from this game and the story that comes with it. It has all the factors from the previos games that you will love and all the fun little easter eggs that come with it.
Awesome game. 8/10
Seem like your dream
My favorite game of all time, great story, great DLC. GET IT. 10/10

A buddy of mine played it and loved it.

I was skeptical because of the crazy amount of hype it was getting.

The hype wasn't kidding.

10/10 A landmark title in gaming history

This game is rather amazing. Given the indepth storyline in the vanilla bioshock infinite, really my only critism is that we could do without the game play and just enjoy the story. In saying that, the game play was fantastic.

Though at first I enjoyed it, it got repetitive and stale fairly quickly. The graphics are great, Elisabeth and the relationship between her and Booker is amazing and the effects are very pretty, but there was little else I found to be enjoyable about this game in the long run.

I kept the more or less same opinion before and after playing the other bioshocks: it feels a good bit like a general shooter, like battlefield or COD when it comes to gameplay. The story was so and so, some hate it, some love it. The ending, some people love it, others hate it. It had some interesting ideas and potential, but repetitiveness killed it for me. I couldn't even bother more than a few hours on my second playthrough (and my playtime counts with DLC and somewhat of a second playthrough).

The story has multiple plot holes and an out of nowhere plot twist that they shamelessly tried to explain in the DLC, and it has little replay value other than getting achievements and collectibles.


If you are looking for something a little different from other shooters (and thats mostly Elisabeth and the powers), pick it up, I can recommend this as an above average shooter, bonus when it is on sale. 

But when I look at the previous bioshock games, this game is a huge failure, having very little to do with the older bioshocks and adding very little good (kind of like the "thief" games).

Wow. Just wow. I never thought they would make a Bioshock game that was better than 1, but I was literally blown away by this game. The graphics, gameplay, story, and characters are all out of this world and it ties into the original Bioshock games making the whole package even prettier. An absolutely amazing game from start to finish with high replay value. Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys any kind of video game.

Hallo,
Bishock Infinte isz eines der besten Games die ich jemals gespielt habe. Es sieht gut aus unf die Story ist unnachahmlich (IMHO: wie in allen Bioshock Teilen). Eine klare Kaufempfehlung, man muss es gespielt haben ;D

Graficos lindos,uma historia Fod# D+,Elizabeth oq + falta?
Esse jogo e muito bom,mas muito bom mesmo os graficos são fantasticos o ambientação de Comlunbia e genial, a historia e FOD% de mais a Elizabeth faz voce se importar com ela,não tipo 'ah que se foda voce menina to aq pra mata tuto" se voce esta jogando assim esta jogando do jeito errado esse e um jogo focado na historia e sendo tambem a melhor parte do jogo e a sua maior fraquez,é extremamente curto eu zerei caçando todos os coletaveis em cerca de 8 horas e zerei de novo na dificuldade super dificil e rendeu cerca de 16 horas,e nesse tempo eu adorei  minha experiencia com jogo mas ai que esta o problema eu zerei achei fod% pra caralh% + não me deu vontade de jogar novamente,porque eu sei tudo que vai acontecer sendo o maior forte do jogo a historia nao tem muito jeito,o gameplay e otimo mas nao o suficiente pra viciar voce no jogo,eu realmente senti falta de um modo co-op ou multiplayer,isso teria extendido muito + a experiencia.
Os personagens sao otimos tanto a Elizabeth ou o Comstock o vilão ou até varios vilões de 2° plano como o Fink etc
minha maior critica ao jogo vem na falta de conteudo e lineariadade do gameplay voce tem sua sniper,rifle,shotgun,lança foguetes etc(que todos sao meio steampunk e muito bem feitos) e o jogo funciona como voce esperaria e meio que um "Call of Bioshock" em alguns pontos.
"e a Elizabeth e gostosa? huehueeuhuee voce faz lepo lepo em algum ponto do jogo?FapFapFap?" NÃO CARA,NÃO FAÇA ISSO! o jogo todo faz voce se importar com a Elizabeth de um jeito partenal é incrivel como hoje em dia qualquer,QUALQUER mulher que saia em algum  jogo e imediatamente sexualizada feita com aqueles "hentais" embora algumas vezes os desenvolvedores mesmo dao uma ajudinha pra trazer uma plublicidade pro jogo "Coff Coff MoxxiCoff Coff" me deixa triste saber que a Elizabeth caiu nessa bagunça,eu sei que algumas mulheres ate gostam disso,e que mulheres gostan de sexo e seria infantil e estupido falar o contrario mas no momento que ela se transforma em objeto...
bem nao se pode fazer muito sobre isso. =(
bem o jogo e otimo porem curto,espera uma promoçãozinha ai que vale muito a pena comprar

Советую всем поиграть. Лучше перед началом инфити пройти первую часть. Будет более менее все понятно

Hands down one of the best games I have ever played. Story is intruiging, characters are like no other, great gameplay, great graohics, fuctions well, and very fair pricing for the dlcs. One of the first games in a while that i have gotten emotionally attached to. Alot of my emotional attachment has to do with Elizabeth, who is my favorite character from any game.
Only problem with the game is its save system as it can leave you having to either play alot more when unwanted or you will have to get off and lose alot of save data (presumably).
10/10
Um dos melhores jogos que já joguei ,gráficos excelentes, personagens fodásticos e a história nem se fala. O cara fica tão envolvido no jogo que depois de virar ele não consegue esquecer.
Great game. Good plot and amazing scenery. Differnt from the previous two in a few ways, but it still fits in and even outdoes the other games. 9/10

This game is a bit of a hard sell for me. based PURELY off the games merits it does what the origonal did, but better. the setting is bright and vibrent which is a welcome change of pace to singing "under the sea" while you are literally under the sea. progression is very liniar with little exploration but things like food and money are hidden EVERYWHERE like its trying to reward you for what little you explore, the story leave a VERY bad taste in my mouth and it could have been handled in a MUCH better style then it was, and the ending is confusing unless you have fallowed the series from the first. i would only recomend buying this game when its on sale.

Bioshock Infinite is a game thatʻs so emotional, itʻs easliy one of the best games of 2013.


[b] Story: [/b]

The story is centered around your character, Booker DeWitt (Voiced by the one and only Troy Baker), a man that is sent to find a girl to pay off a debt. (Just look up explanations of the story, unless you want to find that ALL out.) 10/10

[b] Graphics: [/b]

The graphics are pretty good, but if you donʻt like gel-shaded textures, then you might think to yourself "Damn it! I didnʻt pay for this shit!" 10/10

[b] Score: [/b]

The score (or soundtrack, if you arenʻt fancy) is amazing. It goes to a point where HL2 is a game with a soundtrack made by a 5 year old (Pretty smart 5 year old if you ask me.) 10/10

[b] Characters: [/b]

The characters are introduced very well, but some of them lack. 9/10

[b] DLC: [/b]*

The two AMAZING DLC packs, both titled Burial at Sea, takes us back to Rapture, the place where Bioshock Uno** and Dos*** is in. You get to play as Elizabeth (Only in Burial at Sea Episode 2), the girl Booker is sent to recover in a place where Bioshock fans will have an orgasm porn stars canʻt get. 10/10


[b] Overall: [/b]

Overall, Bioshock Infinite is a (Near) perfect 9/10!




*Not counting Clash in the Clouds, but itʻs okay, I guess....

** One in Spanish

*** Two in Spanish

Un très bon FPS, plus linéaire que les 2 précédents Bioshock, mais quand même très réussi avec une histoire excellente, l'ambience aérienne de "Colombia" participe aussi beaucoup au charme du jeu :) Les DLC sont sympas mais vite parcourus.
This game is great for people who enjoy learning about culture while playing games.
À mon avis, un des meilleurs jeux single player du moment.

Although I may be a bit late, I must say that this game is one of the most emotional games that I have ever played. The soundtrack is gorgeous and the art style fits well with the setting. If you're looking for an amazing game with a beautiful story, then look no further because this is the game for you.

[h1]Bioshock Infinite[/h1]

This is my favourite story driven game ever made for many, many reasons. The story within this game is incredible, it has so many different elements and sections that feel so diverse, yet tie togther so well. 

The enviroments you explore in this world are the most beautiful I have ever seen, from the entire city of Columbia to the interiors of its buildings, some of which tell smaller stories of their own that the player has to discover for themselves.

And the characters. Some of the most intersting and well written/acted characters I have ever seen. The interactions between the two main characters, Booker and Elizabeth, are all amazing and held my interest every time they came up. The story behind these cahracters is made even better when you get to the phenomenal ending, which I wont spoil just play the game and experience it for yourself.

This is the best and most complete story I have every experienced, especially with the DLC which explains a lot of what goes on within the main game.

If you enjoy story games or shooters, this is a must buy, along with the original Bioshock, as that game ties into this one.

[b]Score: 10/10[/b]
A tester absolument!

Simply an amazing experience. I first played the PS3 version when my friend insisted I try it. 전작의 시스템이랑 많이 달라졌다 돈으로 비거, 무기, 탄약을 거래하기 때문에 돈이 정말 중요함 세이브 시스템이 약간 불편하나 감수하고 할정도  특히 스카이라ㄴ인을 이용한 전투방식은 박진감있고 재미있다 스토리 또한 좋음
Increíble, no necesitas más palabras para describir este juego.

Com 13 horas de jogo, explorando bastante o mapa, na dificuldade Normal, terminei o jogo. Vamos lá.

Bioshock Infinite é um jogo FENOMENAL. A história é muito complicado do ínicio pra metade do jogo. Apenas prestando atenção na história e nos voxofones (áudios que vc encontra no decorrer do gameplay) a sua mente começa a clarear um pouco. Mas tem o BOOM SHAKALAKA que são os 20 minutos finais do game, em que sua cabeça apenas explode de tanta informação que é jogada na sua cara. É um plot twist tão absurdo que só dá pra sentir jogando. 

Os gráficos são lindíssimos e a arte do jogo é SENSACIONAL. PQP QUEM FORAM OS DEUSES QUE CRIARAM ISSO? Em muitos momentos vc vai parar o jogo, olhar pro teu teclado, achar a tecla F12 e tirar uma screenshot. 

A dublagem dos atores é algo inacreditavelmente excelente. Procura no youtube Bioshock Infinite - Behind The Scenes HD e veja a profissionalidade desses caras ( não há spoilers no vídeo,tá? ). 

O gameplay, mesmo sendo um FPS, é bem diferente de se acostumar. Comparado a CoD, BF, Medal of Honor, Titanfall......... o jogo é bem lento, mas n quer dizer que seja ruim. É apenas o jeito de Bioshock que é assim desde o 1. O gameplay com armas e vigores ( poderes que nem os Plasmids do Bioshock 1 e 2) é bem divertido de se misturar. A dificuldade do jogo é bem fácil. Eu zerei o jogo no Normal sem morrer uma única vez (considere que sou experiente em jogos de FPS). Se vc tbm é experiente, comece a jogar pelo Hard. 

Resumindo tudo: compre o jogo. Não pensa nem 1 vez sequer. Só compra logo.
Apparently INFINITE translates to 1.8 hours of cringe induced paralysis

It's not a bad game, I've played worse, and if it contained something other than "Bioshock" in the name I wouldn't have any problems recomending it. However, as a Bioshock game, I cannot recomend this. In a couple parts Infinite is a step forward, nice visuals, not bad story, pretty good detail in some of the evironments. In othe parts though it is several steps backwards. 

The main character now speaks, which I find to be extremely imersion breaking and possibly my least favorite thing about this game.
There's probably around 20 guns in the game, but half of them are just weaker reskins of the guns that can be aquired in the first half of the game, also a carrying limit of two guns at a time has been imposed, drastically limitting the options available for killing enemies while increasing the overall annoyance level of the game. 
Using a melee attack is now a quick CoD like event that just involves hitting a button on the keyboard to do a scripted cinematic flashy kill.
The plasmid system and its associated ADAM and EVE mechanics from the first two games are gone, ripped out and replaced by a handful of vigors that attempt to stand in for the old plasmids and a few pieces of magical clothing that try to imitate tonics without success. 
All of the vigors are practically the same, shoot to stun enemies or hold to lay a trap. 
The hacking minigame present in the first two games is completely gone with nothing even attempting to replace it, instead there is the posession vigor that will effortlessly take control of something for a few seconds. 
First aide kits can no longer be stockpiled and carried around and a regenerating shield has been given to the player making health pratically meaningless anyway. 
Should the you somehow get low on health despite the shield, your new buddy Elizabeth will near instantly heal you by tossing you a free first aide kit.
There is nothing really worthwhile to buy from the vending machines, and the few things that are useful are obscenely expensive
There is a very limited number of enemy types with very few inpressive hulks like the ever present Big Daddies of the first two games. Throughout my play through I proabably encountered less than five Handymans, the supposed Big Daddy replacement.
The "boss" fight about halfway through the game just does not know when to end, it's like Irrational outsourced the design for the fight to Square Enix or something. You litterally have to kill the same thing THREE times in a row, and it is constantly summoning and reviving enemies that hardly drop any ammo. Add in the two gun limit on top of this and you quickly run out of bullets while the enemies you literally just killed come back to life over and over again.

Again, call this game by any other name and it will get a pass from me. Try and pass it off as a Bioshock game? I am extremely dissapointed with it and would not think twice about calling it the biggest letdown I've encounted in a long time
Never played Bioshock 1 or 2, and I just finished Infinite. Great game.

Go to a functioning sky-city. Drink superpowers. Find out you're seen as an undesirable. Drink more superpowers. Find the girl and wipe away the debt. You know the drill! Buy the game, would you kindly?!

ok ok... I enjoyed Bioshock 1, and while I skipped 2 when I found Infinite on sale it was a no brainer for me.
I played and I enjoyed the game and I could suggest it as a good FPS.
That was before I complete the game...
The end is so unexpected and so mind blowing that I felt ashamed that I didn't paid full price for the game!

It is the proof that having a good story means nothing without a good end, and the end for this story is just the greatest I have ever seen in a video game, never before I was taken by surprise like that, neither I though "holy s... what did they just though and made here?"

Das Spiel erfindet nichts neues, aber was es macht macht es sehr gut. Bei diesem Spiel geht es auch im Vordergrund nicht um die Spielmechanik, auch wenn diese überragend ist, sondern um die wahnnsinig gute und tiefgreifende Story.
Ich persönlich muss sagen dass ich noch nie ein Spiel mit solch einer fesselnden und zum Nachdenken anregende Story in gespielt habe. Wer nicht den 08/15-gehirnlos-Shooter spielen möchte und Wert auf Charaktere und Story legt, für den ist Bioshock Infinite definitiv ein muss.

Allen die noch kein Spiel der Bioshock-Reihe gespielt haben, kann ich noch mitteilen das man die Vorgänger nicht zwangsweise gespielt haben muss, Bioshock Infinite kann man auch ohne Vorkenntnisse spielen.

- Gameplay ลื่นไหล ถึงตอนแรกๆจะงงวิธีบังคับ
- เนื้อเรื่องทำออกมาได้ดีมากๆ น้ำตาจะไหล
- ปืนมีให้เลือกเยอะแต่ออกจะซ้ำๆกัน
- ท่าทางตัวละครทำออกมาได้ดี
- Elizabeth สวยมาก ยิ่งตอนแสดงท่าทางเล่นหูเล่นตา ถ้าไม่ใช่ลูกนะ ฮี่ๆๆๆๆ

สิ่งที่ไม่ชอบ
- ไม่ชอบตอนจบ มาฆ่าผมทำม้ายยยยยย

เมื่อจับมารวมกันผมให้ 10/10 เพราะผมค่อนข้างหลงไหลเลยเกมนี้
Great adventure. Interesting world. Not bad.
É um jogo muito bom, a história é, como em todos os Bioshocks DEMAIS, recomendo muito.
One of my favorite games! 8.5/10

Эту игру интерено проходить. Кен Левин постарался как всегда на славу. Я ее перепройду лишь для того, чтобы в дальнейшем насладиться всей ее атмосферой, музыкой. В этом шедевре все прекрасно. 10 из 10.

This game is probably among the best I have ever played.  It is absolutely polished.  The stand out for me is Elizabeth.  I VERY rarely felt she was less than a true companion.  Her presence may be the first time having an AI character with you in a game didn't feel like a giant pain in the @$$.  Meaningful conversations are frequent and she is an ally that actually helps.  The small portion of the game without her was lonely!  Bravo!

 The environment is unbelievably rich with everyone room being completely fleshed out.  The powers, guns, items and upgrades are spaced out so that you are constantly acquiring new toys to play with.  And as you spend money to upgrade stuff you really feel them getting more powerful.  The 2 gun system is balanced and fair. The powers are extremely fun to play around with.  There is always a new way to dispatch an enemy.

The combat itself is classic Bioshock; absolute controlled chaos.  I had forgotten how intense the Bioshock combat was and was very happy with the ridiculous pace of it.  

There are a couple of small things that I think could have been better though.  There are two antagonist characters that I don't think were fleshed out enough.  Fitzroy and Slate both had more potential to be more fully fleshed out.  I think a couple more major conversations delving into who they were and more dramatic final confrontations would have done the game a lot of good,  The game also drags a bit in the 3rd quarter.  It dissolves into a bit of a grind of go here and there without a whole lot of motivation.  Specifically the 3 tears quest was a bit boring.  The confrontations with Elizabeth's mother were great, but the quest didn't have to be a grind.  I think more time with Fitzroy and Slate could have created a similar length game experience without the somewhat average portions of the game.  That being said, these things only stand out as negative because the game as a whole is so unbelievably good.

Overall this is probably the best game I have played since Fallout 3.  It has been a very long time since I enjoyed a game this much!

10/10

Feels like a tie with the first Bioshock, though they feel like completely different games.

   I loved the soundtrack, and the voice acting was spot on. The game's setting not being in Rapture was essential. I for one was tired of underwater tunnels, and the sky world is a bright, contrasting switch. The environments are just much more colorful, in comparison to the dim Rapture. Overall, the game was much less dark than the first Bioshock, and the new setting contributes to that. If you're looking for the dark, mysterious, psychotic story and characters of the first game, it's not there. This isn't to say that Infinite does not have interesting characters, because Elizabeth is both an interesting character and good support.
   As far as combat and gameplay goes, I was able to feel more destructive than in the first games. I think the vigors are more interesting than the plasmids of past games. With the introduction of a recharging shield, combat changes considerably. One one hand, the shield removes some of the direness of managing health, and it passively introduces spammy enemies. On the other, this is a different game than the first two. You're having to manage obvious, larger groups of enemies, where in the last games, is was more often a 1v1 or small group, and ambushes were frequent.
Lastly, I liked the ending of the story, but it was a lot of information at once, and it felt rushed.

8/10, would recommend
